column4: wow that nvidia 6200 is a joke...it is the worst driver they have ever produced and it is not  even close to recent versions of vertex and pixel shaders
what? 6200 is a HW model afaik, not a driver :/
the driver isn't bad... the GPU is...
indeed... that's the HW... not the SW...
it's an OLD as (censor) low-budget INTEGRATED gpu... what did you really expect? (no offence, just irritated at people who talks outside proper context)
well i was trying to get full opengl2.0 capability at a low low low price
and it's EOL so don't expect the drivers to get any better... the driver doesn't add any new magical functions that makes it up to standards with todays gfx-cards...
then you made a bad judgement-call... you're fault, not nvidias...
SW-acceleration (like for instance Mesa pre-gallium3D) is slow. period. doesn't have ANYTHING on a modern card on any CPU...
I can see why they disappered... it can't be done on todays CPUs...
well i am not spending any money for anything unless i find some cheap junk in the junk piles
and quite frankly, I can't see how it can ever be done... ever...
yeah been a problem for many many many years but some people are still using the xt so i am not alone with junk stuff
I can relate... My current dev-machine is an old ThinkPad T43 from 2005... but your point is still WRONG
and what did happen too Sun Enterprice exactly ;)
actually TPM and SecureBoot aren't that common...
